data_table.description: Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire, Visit 5. Participants with or without atherosclerosis and cardiovascular disease and involved in the "Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities (ARIC) Cohort" project.

variable.name: SUBJECT_ID
variable.description: ARIC subject ID [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI1A
variable.description: Q1a. Delusions. Does subject believe that others are stealing from him or her, or planning to harm him or her in some way? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI1B
variable.description: Q1b. Delusion severity. Does subject believe that others are stealing from him or her, or planning to harm him or her in some way? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI2A
variable.description: Q2a. Hallucinations. Does subject act as if he or she hears voices? Does he or she talk to people who are not there? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI2B
variable.description: Q2b. Hallucinations severity. Does subject act as if he or she hears voices? Does he or she talk to people who are not there? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI3A
variable.description: Q3a. Agitation or aggression. Is subject stubborn and resistive to help from others? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI3B
variable.description: Q3b. Agitation or aggression severity. Is subject stubborn and resistive to help from others? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI4A
variable.description: Q4a. Depression or dysphoria. Does subject act as if he or she is sad or in low spirits? Does he or she cry? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI4B
variable.description: Q4b. Depression or dysphoria severity. Does subject act as if he or she is sad or in low spirits? Does he or she cry? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI5A
variable.description: Q5a. Anxiety. Does subject become upset when separated from you? Does he or she have any other signs of nervousness, such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI5B
variable.description: Q5b. Anxiety severity. Does subject become upset when separated from you? Does he or she have any other signs of nervousness, such as shortness of breath, sighing, being unable to relax, or feeling excessively tense? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI6A
variable.description: Q6a. Elation or euphoria. Does subject appear to feel too good or act excessively happy? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI6B
variable.description: Q6b. Elation or euphoria severity. Does subject appear to feel too good or act excessively happy? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI7A
variable.description: Q7a. Apathy or indifference. Does subject seem less interested in his or her usual activities and plans of others? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI7B
variable.description: Q7b. Apathy or indifference severity. Does subject seem less interested in his or her usual activities and plans of others? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI8A
variable.description: Q8a. Disinhibition. Does subject seem to act impulsively? For example, does the patient talk to strangers as if he or she know them, or does the patient say things that may hurt people feelings? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI8B
variable.description: Q8b. Disinhibition severity. Does subject seem to act impulsively? For example, does the patient talk to strangers as if he or she know them, or does the patient say things that may hurt people feelings? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI9A
variable.description: Q9a. Irritability or lability. Is subject impatient or cranky? Does he or she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI9B
variable.description: Q9b. Irritability or lability severity. Is subject impatient or cranky? Does he or she have difficulty coping with delays or waiting for planned activities? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI10A
variable.description: Q10a. Motor disturbance. Does subject engage in repetitive activities, such as pacing around the house, handling buttons, wrapping string, or doing other things repeatedly? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI10B
variable.description: Q10b. Motor disturbance severity. Does subject engage in repetitive activities, such as pacing around the house, handling buttons, wrapping string, or doing other things repeatedly? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI11A
variable.description: Q11a. Nighttime behaviors. Does subject awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning or take excessive naps during the day? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI11B
variable.description: Q11b. Nighttime behaviors severity. Does subject awaken you during the night, rise too early in the morning or take excessive naps during the day? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI12A
variable.description: Q12a. Appetite and eating. Has subject lost or gained weight, or had a change in the food he or she likes? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI12B
variable.description: Q12b. Appetite and eating severity. Has subject lost or gained weight, or had a change in the food he or she likes? [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]

variable.name: NPI0AY
variable.description: Q0a. Year of completion date [Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire]
